result.title: Yet another blog... Why?
result.content:
Since kogyblack and I (athoscouto) started studying competitive programming we couldn't solve the problem of how to keep and share all the knowledge that we were learning. As soon as we started we realized we couldn't be much better than the people that were studying and competing with us.

So we assembled a group of people interested from IME (our college) and started teaching them (I'd say that 90% of the effort was kogyblack's). We tried to create Power Point slides, Google Drive docs, sheets, etc.. Even to create our own website with Markdown and LaTeX renderer. Nothing really kind of stuck on.

So I decided to create this blog, where we could create posts about all the topics we would teach people every year. I also started it in English, although our primary language is Portuguese. This last decision has two main reasons: computer science subjects demands good English, the blog contents could be used by more people.

Why to I think is better to write it on Codeforces?

  1. We use it almost everyday.
  2. It's easy to add content.
  3. It's easy to receive feedback.
  4. Content can be easily shared outside our college too.

Although most of our content is available on the web, I'd like to make the best material possible for our peer's needs. we have pretty tight time constraints and search for good content and some unusual tips and tricks (some of them are only available in comments) can be very time consuming. It may not suit the needs of everybody, nor be the best material available, but I hope this blog will be of good use for some :)
